comment._content: Botany Worsted Mills was in Passaic NJ. The workers went on strike March 27 1912. they wanted recognition of their union and a minimum wage of $3 per day.

comment.author: 31676556@N04
comment._content: More on the strike: "The good judgment of the [police] chief and his men was shown in the handling of strikers during the general strike in the mills in [M]arch, 1912. The strikers became so riotous that the mill owners called on the sheriff for assistance and he sent forty deputies who were powerless and it devolved upon the police to quiet the men and induce them to return to work, after five weeks of strenuous work, during which not a man, woman or child was even seriously wounded and none was killed." [From "A History of Passaic and Its Environs (Volume II, Historical-Biographical)" by William W. Scott (1922) archive.org/stream/historyofpassaic02scot/historyofpassai... ]
